newsitem.title: USA: P&C insurers faced few catstrophes in Q1 1997.
newsitem.headline: P&C insurers faced few catstrophes in Q1 1997.

text.p: RAHWAY, N.J. - The Property Claim Service division of American Insurance Services Group Inc an industry trade association, said Tuesday that the industry has faced relatively few catastrophes and light insured property loss during the first three months of the year, suffering $675 million in losses.
The Service said that it had identified six catastrophes during the period, the most serious being the storms and tornados in the southern and southeasatern U.S., which caused $265 million in losses.
The industry handled 364,000 claims during the first quarter, far below the 1.4 million in the first quarter of 1994, resulting mainly from the Northridge earthquake in California.
